Player History
Had first career hit on 4/3/1985, off Mario Soto (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/4/1985, off Jose DeLeon (PIT)...
7/24/1985: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $5,100,000 per year, for 3 years.
Traded from Los Angeles to Toronto on 2/14/1986 (Going to LAD: P Juan Berenguer, P Ron Davis, C Ernie Whitt, 1B Fred McGriff, 3B Mike Bordick. Going to TOR: P Rick Sutcliffe, C Mike Scioscia)...
Injured on 10/19/1987 with a Fractured Jaw, out for 4-5 weeks...
Won World Series with Toronto in 1987...
Was selected to the 1988 Allstar game...
Injured on 7/29/1988 with a Torn Thigh Muscle, out for 6-7 weeks...
8/17/1988: Signed a contract extension with Toronto, $5,390,000 per year, for 3 years.
Drove in 6 runs against Detroit on 6/22/1989...
Traded from Toronto to Los Angeles on 6/24/1991 (Going to LAD: LF Carl Everett, P Ron Mahay, C Mike Scioscia. Going to TOR: P Orel Hershiser, P Dan Plesac, P Mark Davis)...
